name: Rumi (Jalal ad-Din Muhammad Rumi)
description: 13th-century Persian Sufi mystic, poet, and spiritual teacher whose works transcended religious and cultural boundaries to become among the most widely read poetry in the world.
philosophy: Let yourself be silently drawn by the strange pull of what you really love. It will not lead you astray.

historical_context.cultural_milieu: Islamic Golden Age in decline, Mongol invasions disrupting established order, Sufi mysticism flourishing as spiritual refuge
historical_context.political_climate: Fragmented Islamic world, Seljuk sultanate weakening, rise of Mongol Empire creating refugee populations
historical_context.technological_stage: Pre-printing press manuscript culture, oral tradition paramount, madrasa education system
historical_context.social_movements: Sufi orders expanding, mystical brotherhoods providing community structure, synthesis of Islamic law with mystical practice

formative_experiences.event: Family fled Balkh ahead of Mongol invasion, beginning lifelong journey as religious refugee
formative_experiences.psychological_impact: Developed deep understanding of impermanence and detachment from worldly possessions, contributing to mystical worldview

formative_experiences.event: Father Baha ad-Din Walad dies, inheriting position as religious teacher in Konya
formative_experiences.psychological_impact: Forced early spiritual maturity and responsibility, deepening commitment to religious scholarship and community leadership

formative_experiences.event: Transformative encounter with wandering dervish Shams-e Tabrizi
formative_experiences.psychological_impact: Complete spiritual awakening and shift from orthodox scholarship to ecstatic mysticism, discovering the divine beloved

formative_experiences.event: Mysterious disappearance/death of Shams, his spiritual mentor and beloved
formative_experiences.psychological_impact: Profound grief channeled into revolutionary poetic expression, understanding suffering as path to divine love

formative_experiences.event: Establishment of Mevlevi Order with whirling dance as spiritual practice
formative_experiences.psychological_impact: Integration of body, mind, and spirit in worship; institutionalization of mystical experience

key_relationships.influence: Revolutionary mystical awakening; transformed from orthodox scholar to ecstatic poet; inspired concept of divine love through human relationship
Foundation in Islamic scholarship and Sufi tradition; inherited role as community spiritual leader and teacher
Successor relationship after Shams; represented continuation of mystical dialogue and poetic inspiration
Primary recorder of the Masnavi; enabled preservation and systematization of mystical teachings

inherited: Persian poetic tradition and literary sophistication
Sufi emphasis on inner spiritual development
rejected: Worldly attachment to status and position
synthesized: Integration of scholarship with mystical experience
Sacred marriage of human and divine love
Embodied spirituality through music and dance
Teaching through beauty and poetic metaphor

daily_routines: Dawn prayers followed by contemplative recitation
Afternoon periods of mystical poetry composition
Night vigils of dhikr (remembrance) and sama (listening)
work_methods: Spontaneous poetic composition during spiritual states
Integration of music, dance, and poetry in spiritual practice
Oral tradition with later transcription by disciples
Personal example as primary teaching method
social_behaviors: Radical inclusivity toward people of all backgrounds
Gentle humor and storytelling in interactions
Deep listening and presence with visitors
Generous hospitality regardless of social status
Transforming conflict through love and understanding
coping_mechanisms: Whirling dance to achieve mystical states
Channeling grief and loss into poetic expression
Finding divine presence in all experiences
Community of spiritual companions for support
Surrender and acceptance of divine will

quotes: Out beyond ideas of wrongdoing and rightdoing there is a field. I'll meet you there.
The wound is the place where the Light enters you.
Let yourself be silently drawn by the strange pull of what you really love. It will not lead you astray.
